text: Complicity in genocide is illegal under international law, both for individuals (as part of international criminal law) and state parties to the Genocide Convention. * * * * * * * * The latter was first held in the Bosnian genocide case (2007) in which the International Court of Justice (ICJ) held Serbia liable for her failure to prevent the Bosnian genocide. ==Related pages== * The Holocaust * Slobodan Milošević * Yugoslav massacres of Kosovo Albanians during the Kosovo War ==References== Category:Legal terms Category:Bosnian genocide Category:International law
title: Complicity in genocide
